Posts.Content: On 2/26/2007 Marshabel wrote: Had lumpectomy and sent node biopsy 2 weeks ago.Lymph nodes and margins clear, HR and PR negative, grade 3, invasive ductal carcinoma, approx 3.5 cm. As for the HER2, it said no over expression. Not sure what that means. My oncology appt is still days away, and I am going crazy with the waiting and wondering. Feeling overwhelmed by it all, and don't know what to do about my job. I took a medical leave when this started, but don't know how to plan for a return to work until I know something more definite. Is there anyone out there with a similar diagnosis who can give me a clue on what  to expect? Marshabel   Yes I just found this page today.  I was diagnosed with invasive ductal carcinoma on 2/28 and am going to have a bilateral mastectomy on Tuesday March 20th - one week from today. I am told I will have to have chemo and radiation but have no details of that yet, have not met with an oncologist yet. I've only met with my surgeon and a plastic surgeon who will both be in the OR at the same time.  I live in Vancouver, Washington, very close to Portland, OR.  My name is Marsha and I am 51.
Posts.Title: new diagnosis, anyone similar?

Posts.Content: Hopefully within the next month I'll be exchanging my expanders (bilateral) for implants.  I don't know much about implants and wondered if you all could share your advice and experiences? When I leave the hospital, will I have surgical drains in?  If so, for the same amount of time approx as with the bilateral mastectomy surgery? Do you have any idea how soon I could return to my office job?  Next day? Thanks so much, Marsha in Vancouver, WA
